meanings.definition: To commemorate or honor the memory of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The family memorialises their grandfather by visiting his grave every year.
meanings.sent2: The community memorialises fallen soldiers with a yearly ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The town memorialises their first mayor by naming a street after him.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork memorialises the beauty of nature in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The statue memorialises the bravery of the firefighters who saved the town.

meanings.definition: To preserve the memory of someone or something through a memorial or tribute.
meanings.sent1: The museum memorialises the history of the ancient civilization through artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The plaque memorialises the historic event that took place in this building.
meanings.sent3: The school memorialises its founding teacher with a scholarship in her name.
meanings.sent4: The song memorialises the love story of the famous couple in poetic lyrics.
meanings.sent5: The painting memorialises the artist's hometown with intricate details.
